name: Kepler-424
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-424 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-424 is a star with 1.01 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.94 times its radius. It is located 2325.07 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-424 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-424 system


Kepler-424 b

Kepler-424 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-424 b is 327.54 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-424 b is 9.98 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-424 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


Kepler-424 c

Kepler-424 c was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.73 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-424 c is 2216.46 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-424 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-424, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
